info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles north of Cimarron, or 22 miles southwest of Raton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Colfax County. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 325 and 330. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
